text: thumb Peter Watson (born 1950), is a male retired cyclist who competed for England. ==Cycling career== Watson won the King of the Mountains in the 1973 Tour of Britain and recorded 19 career victories from 1968-1982. He represented England in the road race, at the 1974 British Commonwealth Games in Christchurch, New Zealand. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:English male cyclists Category:Cyclists at the 1974 British Commonwealth Games Category:Living people
title: Peter Watson (cyclist)
